alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 2:37PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IS NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST/MIDNIGHT MDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding on Chinle Wash caused by snowmelt in the Chuska Mountains will continue through this week. This is mainly due to flow over spillways of Tsaile Dam and Wheatfields Dam, bringing water down Canyon del Muerto and Coyote Wash. * WHERE...Chinle Wash, near and downstream of Chinle and especially near the entrance to Canyon de Chelly National Monument. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MST Friday /Midnight MDT Saturday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding in and adjacent to Chinle Wash and upstream washes, creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM MST /300 PM MDT/, Navajo Nation officials report that flooding is still occurring in and near Chinle Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinle, Canyon De Chelly National Monument and portions of the Navajo Nation just downstream of Chinle. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Keep children away from culverts, creeks and washes! Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
